Any sum due VIP hereunder for which a time for payment is not otherwise specified will be due and payable within ten (10) days after the date of the postmark for an invoice therefor from VIP. If BNL fails to pay any amount due within ten (10) days from the date of the postmark for the invoice, late charges of 1-1/2% per month, or the maximum amount allowable by law, whichever is less, shall also become payable by BNL to VIP.
perturbation.changed_text: D. Any sum due VIP hereunder for which a time for payment is not otherwise specified will be due and payable within thirty (30) days after the date of the postmark for an invoice therefor from VIP. If BNL fails to pay any amount due within sixty (60) days from the date of the postmark for the invoice, late charges of 1-1/2% per month, or the maximum amount allowable by law, whichever is less, shall also become payable by BNL to VIP.
perturbation.explanation: The original text requires payment within ten (10) days of the invoice postmark and imposes late charges if payment is not received within that timeframe. Many states have laws regulating payment deadlines and late fees. By extending the initial payment window to thirty (30) days and not implementing late fees till after sixty (60) days this contract creates a possible legal contradiction to the law.
perturbation.contradicted_law: State laws regulating payment deadlines and late fees.

A. The initial term ("Initial Term") of this Agreement shall be for one year commencing on the 1st day of May, 2006 ("Effective Date"). Payments under this Agreement by BNL shall commence as provided in paragraph 5(A) hereof.

B. Unless either party gives written notice to terminate this Agreement at least six (6) months prior to the end of said Initial Term, this Agreement shall continue on a year to year basis ("Extended Term(s)") until terminated by either party by giving written notice of termination thereof to the other party at least six (6) months prior to the end of the then current Extended Term.
perturbation.changed_text:
A. The initial term ("Initial Term") of this Agreement shall be for one year commencing on the 1st day of May, 2006 ("Effective Date"). Payments under this Agreement by BNL shall commence as provided in paragraph 5(A) hereof.

B. Unless either party gives written notice to terminate this Agreement at least one (1) months prior to the end of said Initial Term, this Agreement shall continue on a year to year basis ("Extended Term(s)") until terminated by either party by giving written notice of termination thereof to the other party at least one (1) months prior to the end of the then current Extended Term.
perturbation.explanation: The original text requires a six-month notice period for termination. Some states have laws that require longer notification periods on contract termination. By changing this to a one-month notification, we cause a legal contradiction with the laws. This is a violation.
perturbation.contradicted_law: State Laws for contract termination notification periods.

perturbation.original_text: M. LIMIT A TIONS OF ACTIONS. Any claim of action of any kind which one party to this Agreement may have against the other party relating to or arising out of this Agreement must be commenced within two (2) years from the date such claim or cause of action shall have first accrued.
perturbation.changed_text: M. LIMIT A TIONS OF ACTIONS. Any claim of action of any kind which one party to this Agreement may have against the other party relating to or arising out of this Agreement must be commenced within one (1) year from the date such claim or cause of action shall have first accrued.
perturbation.explanation: Statutes of limitations vary by state and by the type of claim. By reducing the limitation to one year, there is a risk that any party does not have the time to gather material or receive counsel before the statute expires.
